page.title: 06FARMING IN OUR AREA
page.content: Whole area is basically agricultural with two small villages.We found 2 types of farming.Two farms were traditionally worked as complete units under the owners with a few labourers. Both farms had crops and animals, grazing shed held cows.Those remaining were satellites attached to larger farms outside our area.Very little machinery was kept on these farms.Both workers and machines were mobile,being brought to the farm as work demanded. Crop rotation no longer used.Most land was under wheat for milling or animal feed or malting barley.Every few years break crops such as oil seed rape,peas or beans are grown.Many large fields made for modern machinery but farmers are growing higher hedges to aid conservation.Small orchards of apples, pears and plums flourish here too.
